articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Sympathy to Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Sympathy to Fidel Castro Ruz 
   Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba.
 The message said:   
 Shocked to learn that you underwent an operation for unexpected sudden illness, I express profound sympathy and consolation to you. I wholeheartedly hope that you will recover your health as early as possible so that you may continue successfully fulfilling the heavy responsibility entrusted to you by the Cuban revolution and people.

Support to Korean People's Struggle Called for
articles.content:
Support to Korean People's Struggle Called for 
   Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The Tunisia-Korea Friendship Association issued a statement on July 25 on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people. It called upon all the peace-loving forces to fully support the just struggle of the Korean people.
 The statement extended militant solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to frustrate the moves of the U.S. imperialists for aggression and reunify the country in the idea of "By our nation itself." It demanded the United States stop at once its threat of aggression for a new war and pressure and its acts against the reunification of Korea.
 It is an urgent requirement for providing the Korean people with conditions for reunifying the country by their concerted efforts to force the U.S. troops to quit south Korea, the statement noted.

articles.title: Talks Held between Foreign Ministers of DPRK and Singapore
articles.content:
Talks Held between Foreign Ministers of DPRK and Singapore 
   Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Talks between Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun who is heading the DPRK delegation on an official visit to Singapore and Singaporean Foreign Minister George Yong-Boon Yeo were held in Singapore on Tuesday.
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the delegation and the DPRK ambassador to Singapore and from the Singaporean side were the second permanent secretary of the Foreign Ministry and officials concerned.    
 The Singaporean foreign minister gave a reception for the DPRK delegation on the same day.

Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from President of Maldives
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from President of Maldives
   Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a message of sympathy from Maumoon Abdul Gayoom, president of Maldives, on July 24 in connection with the recent downpour and flood that hit various parts of the DPRK, claiming big human and material losses.
  In the message the president expressed on behalf of the Maldivian government and people and on his own behalf sincere sympathy to Kim Jong Il and the government and people of the DPRK and to the people in the afflicted area, in particular, and offered deep condolences to the bereaved families.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Message of Sympathy from Indonesian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Message of Sympathy from Indonesian President
   Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received on July 27 a message of sympathy from Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, president of Indonesia, in connection with the recent typhoon and downpour that hit some areas of the DPRK, causing a big flood and landslide and claiming huge human and material losses.
 The message said that the president and the government and people of Indonesia express profound sympathy and consolation to Kim Jong Il and the people of the DPRK and to those families in the afflicted areas which lost their beloved ones, in particular.

Singaporean Leaders on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Singaporean Leaders on Relations with DPRK
   Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- S.R. Nathan, president of Singapore, when meeting with a delegation of the DPRK led by Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun on a visit to his country on August 2, said the DPRK and Singapore are close friends that have had friendly relations with each other from the 1960s. Singapore hopes for prosperity of the DPRK and welfare of the Korean people, he noted.
 He stressed that the issue of the Korean Peninsula should be settled through dialogues and negotiations and the reunification of Korea should be achieved peacefully.    
 Meanwhile, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, when meeting with the DPRK delegation on August 1, said that the relations between the two countries have developed favorably for several decades and hoped that their cooperation would be expanded in the economic fields including trade in the future.
